# Introduction

This is a book created from markdown and executable code.

Let's investigate some tables.

### Markdown table

| r estimate (ignoring sign) | Strength |
|----------------------------|----------|
| <0.3                       | Poor     |
| 0.3 to <0.6                | Fair     |
| 0.6 to <0.8                | Moderate |
| >=0.6                      | Strong   |

: A simple markdown table {#tbl-md}

### gt

```{r, echo=FALSE}
#| label: tbl-1-1
#| tbl-cap: "A simple gt table"

library(huxtable)
library(gt)
library(gtsummary)
library(knitr)

rdf <- tibble::tribble(
  ~`r estimate (ignoring sign)`, ~Strength,
  "<0.3", "Poor",
  "0.3 to <0.6", "Fair",
  "0.6 to <0.8", "Moderate",
  ">=0.6", "Strong")

gt::gt(rdf)
```

### huxtable

```{r, echo=FALSE}
#| label: tbl-1-2
#| tbl-cap: "A simple huxtable"
 
huxtable(rdf) %>% 
  theme_article()
```

### gtsummary -> huxtable
```{r, echo=FALSE}
#| label: tbl-1-3
#| tbl-cap: "A simple gtsummary table"

tbl_summary(mtcars) %>% 
  as_hux_table() %>% 
  theme_article()
```

### knitr::kable
```{r, echo=FALSE}
#| label: tbl-1-4
#| tbl-cap: "A simple kable"
 
knitr::kable(rdf)
```
